name: 1555 Malabia House

reviews.title: We miss you Malabia House!
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at Malabia House for 5 nights in late December while in Buenos Aires, before heading south through Patagonia. We can't say enough positive things about our stay here. The hotel is in Palermo Soho, a walking neighborhood of suberb restaurants, excellent shopping and sightseeing. The hotel itself is comfortable, relaxing and quiet. Upon arrival, staff brought us drinks and cookies - and gave us an overview of the neighborhood and Buenos Aires with a map.

reviews.title: Look no further than Malabia
reviews.text: Sebastian and Andrea: Thank you so much for your hospitability and kindness. You definitely made our stay very welcoming and comfortable!!

reviews.title: Quiet, central and delightful
reviews.text: Our room had a balcony to the street with tall doors overlooking a beautifully green and full tree. We thought that there might be street noise but we heard nothing. The bathroom was not in our room but down the hall. That is truly the only "complaint". The bathroom was for our sole use. Some rooms had bathrooms en suite and others didn't. Those that didn't still had their own private bathroom, just down or across the hall. The beds are amazing - best beds we slept in during our trip through Argentina. Breakfast started at 7:00 AM without a end time - for those folks who needed to sleep in.

reviews.title: Highly recommended
reviews.text: All in all we loved it.

reviews.title: Home away from home
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in Malabia last October for a few days. It was the start of our honeymoon. We stayed in the room with the balcony overlooking the street. The bathroom is separate but we did not find that a problem in any way. The room is spacious, bright, modern while keeping it's obvious old charm.

We originally were scheduled to stay at a little B&B in Palermo, BA...but upon arrival, we were horrified with the conditions of the supposed B&B that were really more in line with a low-budget hostel. So we began making emergency phone calls to find a more desirable place to stay. The Malabia had a cancelation (we had tried to book there originally but they were sold out) so we headed right over and were so glad we did. It was adorable. We were greated with coffee and pastries in their sitting area, and were escorted right to our room even though we were several hours early for check in. They included a delicious daily breakfast that had no time limit--they even had place settings ready for us the day we slept in till 2pm after a late night out!
reviews.title: Malabia House Saved the Day!
An excellent find in BA!
reviews.text: They were very helpful with restaurant and excursion suggestions, internet was available 24 hrs a day, and in general they were extremely hospitable and welcoming.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just stayed five nights at Malabia House, and could not have been more pleased with the accomodations, location, food, and most importantly, the staff. The B&B was recently restored, and has more the feeling of a house than a hotel, with elegant modern furnishings that provide hints of the building's past. The breakfasts served famiy-style are also a treat, with whatever request you have been quickly prepared while you enjoy coffee/juice/etc. The staff, however, is what really separates Malabia from the competition, as they arranged whatever nightlife you wanted (Tango shows, dinner reservations), provided tips on what there was to see and were very friendly for casual conversation (they also remember every guest's name, which is a nice touch). We had a bad experience at another BA hotel, and were thrilled to come back to the warm hospitality of Malabia House. We'll be sure to stay here on our next trip to BA!
reviews.title: Stylish or what?!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just didn't know what to expect! Hotel website very enticing so we went for it and booked. Mind you there were so many good reviews in the BA guide books and various websites that our expectations were high before we arrived.
reviews.title: Home away from home

likes.disliked: — Small bathrooms, out of the bedtooms

reviews.text: In the heart of the bohemian Palermo barrio of BA there we found the Malabia House Hotel (don't forget the 1555 part of the address). It is an excellent example of a boutique hotel, stylish, loads of character and with little touches that surprise and please all around the place. What about the room? We had a superior room which is smaller than the others, you pay more but the bathroom and toilet are en-suite unlike the other rooms. So check out exactly what type of room you want when you book. Not a lot of space in the room and the bathroom is a tight squeeze but hey! Are you going to live in the room all day? I doubt it. Queen size bed is a fantastic by the way! Breakfast is served communal style round a large kitchen table. The lovely George is on hand to cook your eggs any way you want them and there is also a good supply of the local Dulce de Leche on the table to spread on the unbelievably good bread.
reviews.title: Malabia House is Perfect for Buenos Aires

reviews.text: This B&B is some kind of petite luxury hotel in the coolest Buenos Aires neighborhood (Palermo). Excelent if traveling in a romantic getaway (I did it for business and really worked out!).
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: You receive personalized attention, the staff is really helpfull.
reviews.title: Excellent Boutique Hotel
Feels like luxury thanks to the staff and product delivery
reviews.text: The only con (which is not exactly something negative) is that in the kind of room I stayed (139 USD) the bathroom is outside the bedroom (is private); for me did not cause any problem since the hotel is small.
If in Buenos Aires, I really recommend this option!!!
reviews.title: Unbelievable service

likes.disliked: — To small sinks in room, towels not fluffy. Nitpicking here.

reviews.title: Just to confirm
reviews.text: I spent 2 weeks at the Malabia House in 2004 as part of a 2-month stay in Argentina. The Malabia House was far and away the nicest place I stayed during the trip. From the moment I got there, the staff was so helpful getting me settled, helping me get local currency, checking my email, and arranging for transportation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I used Trip Advisor to look for a suitable hotel in BA and the reviews for 1555 Malabia House looked good. We weren't disappointed!
reviews.title: haven in BA

likes.disliked: — no outside window and thin walls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The transfer guy was there at the airport with our name board - a relatively quick trip had us arriving at the hotel. The staff were incredibly friendly and literally bent over backwards to help us (heavy suitcases!). A relaxed check in with soft drinks in the lounge. The room was minimalist but with some little extras. I was a little hesitant to book as some rooms don't have ensuite facilities but as we contacted the hotel direct we reserved our actual room - you can see them on the website. Be warned, only a few rooms have outside windows. Most look into the beautiful interior courtyard, but the walls are thin!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Hospitality BUT noisy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The loaction is superb if you like the more relaxed side of BA - good restaurants and bars within easy walking distance. The streets surrounding the hotel are quiet and have some good shops.
reviews.title: Great B&B for Location & Staff

reviews.text: If you're looking for a peaceful haven in noisy BA then stay here. It's only a taxi ride away from the hustle and bustle!
reviews.title: Superb B&B
Great Time at Malabia House
reviews.text: I agreed with all of the reviews here. The hotel is charming, the staff is friendly and the location is excellent!!

description: 1555 Malabia House Boutique Hotel is set in a 19th-century building surrounded by restaurants and shops in the Palermo Viejo neighborhood.All accommodations are well-appointed with luxurious furniture and modern amenities, including air conditioning, cable TV and free internet access.
